name: UpdateEventExportConfiguration
auth_description: Requires a user of type `Employee` or `Api` with functionality `EventExportConfiguration:Edit`

headers.name: EVA-User-Agent
headers.description: The user agent that is making these calls. Don't make this specific per device/browser but per application. This should be of the form: `MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0`

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnitID
headers.description: The ID of the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnit-Query
headers.description: The query that selects the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-Mode
headers.description: The IDs mode to run this request in. Currently only `ExternalIDs` is supported.

request_samples.name: CURL

E.name: Certificate
E.description: A client certificate that can be used for mTLS. Must be X509 in PKCS12 format. Also, it must not be expired, have a private key and have clientAuth in it's extended key usage.

E.name: Password
E.description: The password that is used to encrypt the certificate.

D.name: StaticBearerToken
D.description: This will result in an authorization header that looks like: `Authorization: Bearer TOKEN`

D.name: StaticUnschemedToken
D.description: This will result in an authorization header that looks like: `Authorization: TOKEN`. Use this only when the other options are not sufficient.

F.name: TargetID
F.description:
Possible values:

* `1` - Order
* `2` - Shipment
* `3` - PaymentTransaction
* `4` - Customer
* `5` - Invoice
* `6` - StockMutation
* `7` - OrganizationUnit
* `8` - FinancialPeriod
* `9` - FinancialPeriodAudit
* `10` - OrderFulfillmentLine
* `11` - System
* `12` - UserTasks
* `13` - CashCorrection
* `14` - CashDeposit
* `15` - CashExpense
* `16` - CashMovement
* `17` - RecurringTask
* `18` - OrderFulfillment
* `19` - Coupon
* `20` - ProductAvailability
* `21` - Repairs
* `22` - StockNotification
* `23` - SerialNumber
* `24` - LoyaltyProgram
* `25` - Cases
* `26` - Wishlist

C.name: Authorization
C.description:
Authorization configuration used when calling this endpoint.

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

C.name: ExcludeOrganizationUnitSets
C.description:
Exclude certain organization unit sets. If not set, no organization units will be excluded.

This is the ID of a `OrganizationUnitSet`

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

C.name: ExcludeOrganizationUnits
C.description:
Exclude certain organization units. If not set, no organization units will be excluded.

This is the ID of a `OrganizationUnit`

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

C.name: ExcludedMessageTypes
C.description:
Exclude certain message types. If not set, no message types will be excluded.

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

C.name: IncludeOrganizationUnitSets
C.description:
Filter for certain organization unit sets. If not set, all organization units will be sent.

This is the ID of a `OrganizationUnitSet`

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

C.name: IncludeOrganizationUnits
C.description:
Filter for certain organization units. If not set, all organization units will be sent.

This is the ID of a `OrganizationUnit`

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

C.name: MessageTypes
C.description:
Filter for certain message types. If not set, all message types will be sent.

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

C.name: Protocol
C.description:
The protocol to use when sending the data. If not set, the best available version of HTTP will be used.
Possible values:

* `0` - HTTP_ANY
* `1` - HTTP_1_1

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

C.name: ResponseMode
C.description:
Defines what kind of response EVA requires from this endpoint.
Possible values:

* `0` - Normal
* `1` - Loose

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

C.name: ScriptID
C.description:
The protocol to use when sending the data. If not set, the best available version of HTTP will be used.

This is the ID of a `Script`

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

C.name: TimeoutSeconds
C.description:
Timeout after which event exports are cancelled. Defaults to 5 seconds. Not recommended to change.

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

B.name: Config
B.description: While this property is not required, if it is sent in the request it must have a valid value.

B.name: Endpoint
B.description: While this property is not required, if it is sent in the request it must have a valid value.

B.name: ID
B.description: This is the ID of a `EventExportConfiguration`

B.name: Name
B.description: While this property is not required, if it is sent in the request it must have a valid value.

B.name: Status
B.description:
Possible values:

* `1` - Enabled
* `2` - Disabled
* `3` - Error
* `4` - Done

While this property is not required, if it is sent in the request it must have a valid value.

H.name: Code
H.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

H.name: Message
H.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

H.name: RequestID
H.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

H.name: Type
H.description: A short description of the error type.

I.name: ExternalIDs
I.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

I.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
I.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

I.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
I.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.
